TEXT: The applicants are all NORP nationals . Their details are set out in a list appended to this decision . The applications were lodged by the applicants acting on their own behalf and in their capacity as the heirs of their deceased parents .
They were represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicants or their ascendants were the owners of immovable property in GPE , but were dispossessed after GPE became independent .

PERSON , PERSON and their mother , PERSON , jointly owned , as part of the family estate , CARDINAL parcels of agricultural land ( CARDINAL in GPE with surface - areas of CARDINAL hectares and QUANTITY , and CARDINAL in PERSON with surface - areas of QUANTITY and QUANTITY ) and CARDINAL properties in GPE , CARDINAL a CARDINAL - roomed house and the other a CARDINAL - roomed house . PERSON also owned a property that was let out to tenants and a wine wholesalers in GPE .

These properties were valued by the NORP authorities using a scale laid down by a law of DATE . The first applicant ’s share was put at MONEY ( ORG ) at the DATE value of the franc , the second applicant ’s share at ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL and their mother ’s share at ORG CARDINAL . Pursuant to a law of CARDINAL DATE the properties were revalued at ORG , ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL and ORG respectively ( at the DATE value ) . In “ real terms ” the “ DATE value ” of the properties would be ORG CARDINAL , ORG and ORG CARDINAL respectively .
The DATE compensatory payments allegedly received by each of the first CARDINAL applicants since DATE amount to ORG . Their mother has allegedly received ORG ( at the DATE value ) .

Mr PERSON jointly owned , as part of the family estate , a house at PERSON . The property was valued by the NORP authorities , using the scale laid down by the law of DATE , at ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( at the DATE value ) . Pursuant to the law of DATE it was revalued at CARDINAL “ francs at the DATE value ” , which the applicant said came to MONEY at the DATE value ” . The DATE compensatory payments he has allegedly received since DATE amount to FRF MONEY at the DATE value ” .

Further , Mr PERSON , the father of PERSON and PERSON PERSON , owned CARDINAL parcels of agricultural land QUANTITY at FAC ( which was matrimonial property ) and QUANTITY at PERSON – and CARDINAL buildings at GPE ( which was also matrimonial property ) . These properties were valued by the authorities , using the scale laid down by the law of PERCENT , at ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( at the DATE value ) . Pursuant to the law of DATE these properties were revalued at MONEY at the DATE value ” , which the applicants said came to MONEY at the DATE value ” . As the property was jointly owned by the brother and sister as part of the family estate , each was entitled to ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL .
The DATE compensatory payments received by PERSON and his father since DATE allegedly amounted to MONEY at the DATE value ” and by PERSON and her father to MONEY at the DATE value ” .

In addition , the ORG mother , PERSON , owned CARDINAL parcels of agricultural land QUANTITY FAC ( which was matrimonial property ) and CARDINAL hectares at FAC DATE and CARDINAL buildings at GPE , CARDINAL of which were matrimonial property while the third was owned jointly as part of the family estate . These properties were valued by the authorities , using the scale laid down by the law of DATE , at ORG CARDINAL ( at the DATE value ) . Pursuant to the law of DATE the properties were revalued at MONEY at the DATE value ” , which the applicants said came to MONEY at the DATE value ” . As the property was jointly owned by the brother and sister as part of the family estate , each was entitled to FRF CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL .
The DATE compensatory payments received by PERSON and his mother since DATE allegedly amounted to MONEY at the DATE value ” and by PERSON and her mother to MONEY at the DATE value ” .

PERSON jointly owned , as part of the family estate , a house situated at PERSON , a flat and a plot of building land in GPE , and CARDINAL parcels of agricultural land QUANTITY at FAC and QUANTITY at ORG . These properties were valued by the authorities , using the scale laid down by the law of DATE , at ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( at the DATE value ) . Pursuant to the law of DATE they were revalued at MONEY at the DATE value ” , which the applicant said came to MONEY at the DATE value ” . The DATE compensatory payments she had allegedly received since DATE amounted to FRF MONEY at the DATE value ” .

Mr PERSON father owned QUANTITY of land at LOC , and CARDINAL building plots and a house at FAC . These properties were valued by the authorities , using the scale laid down by the law of DATE , at ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( at the DATE value ) . Pursuant to the law of DATE they were revalued at MONEY at the DATE value ” , which the applicant said came to MONEY at the DATE value ” . The DATE compensatory payments allegedly received by the applicant ’s father since DATE amounted to ORG MONEY at the DATE value ” .

Acting on their own behalf or , as applicable , as the heirs and assigns of their ascendants , the applicants sent a demand to the Secretary of ORG in DATE for the payment of the balance of the value of the nationalised properties , together with interest .

They submitted that by virtue of the “ NORP LAW ” and unilateral undertakings given in writing by ORG , ORG had an obligation to pay “ just and fair ” compensation to persons who had been dispossessed of their property . They added inter alia that there had been a violation of LAW No . CARDINAL and of LAW , as they had received only partial compensation , .

In DATE they applied to ORG for an order setting aside the Secretary of ORG ’s decision , which was deemed to have been a refusal as he had not replied within DATE . ORG dismissed their applications on DATE .
The applicants appealed to ORG , which dismissed their appeals on DATE on the following grounds :

“ ... Neither the ORG ’s declarations of CARDINAL DATE regarding GPE , known as the “ LOC ” , nor the leaflet “ the Évian Accords and the CARDINAL - noirs [ NORP born NORP ] ” , which was published and distributed in DATE by ORG of GPE , nor the declarations made at the time by members of ORG , which were confined to comments on the aforementioned accords , contained , contrary to what has been submitted in the appeal , clauses or promises affording NORP nationals living in GPE a guarantee that ORG would compensate them for any loss resulting from their being wrongfully divested of their property by ORG . It follows that the court must reject the argument that the ORG has engaged its responsibility and failed to comply with its undertakings because compensation has been paid for only part of the loss of the property in issue .

The loss sustained ... , which directly originated from the action of a foreign ORG , can not give rise to liability on the part of ORG on the basis of the rule that public burdens shall be borne equally ( principe de l’égalité devant les charges publiques ) .

In accordance with the final paragraph of LAW of DATE on ORG , GPE DATE referred to above instituted a national levy to raise compensation for NORP nationals who had been dispossessed of their property , notably in GPE . The amount of compensation paid to such persons pursuant to that statute has been increased by LAW DATE and DATE referred to above , the amount being limited , however , by the latter statute to MONEY depending on the circumstances . [ Although it has been submitted ] that the payment of compensation for only part of the loss contravenes both the principles of national solidarity and payment of compensation of loss in full and the right to the protection of property guaranteed by the LAW , the LAW DATE and the Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen of DATE to which it refers , it is not for the administrative courts to determine the constitutionality of those statutory provisions . By instituting a national levy to provide compensation in the form of an advance on the sums owed to NORP nationals by ORG for the dispossession of their property , by making the share of the compensation fund apportioned to each dispossessed person proportional to the value of the property which he or she had lost and by imposing a general limit on the amount of that share in the light of the resources which the nation could reasonably devote to it , the aforementioned statutes do not contain any provision that is incompatible with GPE ’s international obligations under , on the one hand , LAW No . CARDINAL to the Convention ... relating to unlawful interference with private property by any of the GPE that have signed the ORG or , on the other hand , LAW , which prohibit any discrimination between individuals .... ”

The applicants appealed to the ORG d’État , alleging , inter alia , a violation of LAW No . CARDINAL and LAW . They also maintained that , in violation of LAW and of their right to a fair hearing , ORG had not acted as an independent and impartial tribunal , as it had “ regarded itself as being bound in practice by the interpretation of the Minister of Foreign Affairs ” , as reproduced in the PERSON judgment delivered by the PERSON d’État on CARDINAL DATE .
On DATE the ORG d’État dismissed the appeals on points of law for the following reasons :
“ The ground of appeal based on the interpretation of the declarations made by the Government on DATE regarding GPE , known as the ‘ NORP Accords’ :

An examination of the impugned judgment , which contains sufficient reasons , shows that for the purposes of interpreting those provisions of the aforementioned accords which were relied on , ORG did not regard itself as being bound by the interpretation the Minister of ORG may have given and , therefore , did not infringe either the provisions of Article CARDINAL of the ... Convention ... , or , in any event , the first sub - paragraph of LAW . Further , in finding that the said declarations did not contain any clause or promise guaranteeing NORP nationals living in GPE compensation from ORG for any loss sustained in the event of their being wrongfully divested of their property by ORG , ORG has not erred in law . It was entitled in law to deduce from that finding that the ORG ’s responsibility could not be engaged on the ground that it had failed to comply with the terms of the said declarations .
The ground of appeal based on the ORG ’s promises :

ORG did not misconstrue the scope of the leaflet entitled ‘ LAW and the CARDINAL noirs’ , which was published and distributed in DATE by ORG of GPE , by holding that it contained no undertaking or promise by ORG to pay compensation in full for losses sustained by NORP owners dispossessed of their property in GPE should the NORP State fail to pay compensation .
The ground of appeal based on the fact that the compensation award ... contravened various principles and NORP international obligations :

Firstly , the loss sustained ... , which directly originated from the action of a foreign ORG , can not , as ORG rightly held , result in the responsibility of ORG being engaged on the basis of the rule that public burdens shall be borne equally .

Secondly , the administrative courts have no jurisdiction to decide whether the system of lump - sum partial compensation set up by the Laws ... of DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE infringe quasi - constitutional rules and principles and ORG rightly declined to examine that issue .

Thirdly , ORG did not err in law in holding that the decision of ORG ( which , as has been explained above , was under no obligation to take the place of the defaulting NORP State in compensating the dispossessed NORP owners in full ) to award partial compensation when the direct cause of the damage was the act of a foreign state could not have infringed LAW No CARDINAL to LAW ... , LAW , or , in any event , LAW .... ”

“ NORP nationals who have been or have considered themselves compelled by political events to leave a territory in which they were settled and which was previously under NORP sovereignty or administration , or was a NORP protectorate , are eligible for assistance from the State ...
Such assistance shall take the form of a series of measures designed to integrate the repatriated NORP nationals into the nation ’s economic and social structures .

These measures shall consist , in particular , of return allowances , temporary subsistence allowances , reduced - rate loans and resettlement and regrading subsidies , measures facilitating access to work and schools , and welfare payments and exceptional relief for repatriated persons ... ”

“ The amount of compensation for conclusively proved wrongful divestment and loss of property belonging to the persons referred to in the first sub - paragraph of CARDINAL and the procedure for its assessment and payment shall be laid down , in the light of the circumstances , in separate legislation ... ”
On DATE the NORP and ORG signed various declarations of principle ( “ the NORP LAW ” ) .
The “ Declaration of Principles governing Economic and Financial Cooperation ” stated , inter alia :

“ GPE shall secure without discrimination free and quiet enjoyment of pecuniary rights acquired in its territory prior to self - determination . No one shall be deprived of these rights without fair compensation determined beforehand . ”
“ As part of the agrarian reform , GPE shall provide GPE with special aid for the repurchase of all or part of the property rights of NORP nationals .

On the basis of a repurchase scheme to be devised by the competent NORP authorities the form the aid will take shall be determined by agreement between the CARDINAL countries that will reconcile the implementation of GPE ’s economic and social policy with the need to stagger GPE ’s financial assistance over a reasonable period . ”

In a referendum of DATE the NORP people approved a bill providing that “ the President of the Republic may enter into all such agreements as shall be drawn up in accordance with the Government ’s declarations of DATE ” and “ may decide on ... any statutory or regulatory measures relating to the application of the ORG ’s declarations of CARDINAL DATE ” .

In a judgment of CARDINAL DATE in the PERSON case , the PERSON d’État , interpreting the declarations in the same way as the Minister of ORG had done , held that they did not contain “ any provision intended to secure NORP residents in GPE who alleged that their rights [ had ] been infringed , a right to compensation from ORG for the damage sustained ” .
A leaflet entitled “ The Évian Accords and the CARDINAL noirs ” , published in DATE by ORG of GPE , stated , inter alia , as follows :

“ ... [ After GPE becomes independent ] your landed property will be protected . For those of you who are farmers your land may only be expropriated under a repurchase scheme and in exchange for fair compensation with financing guaranteed by aid from GPE ...
All these commitments will be honoured . You are assured of that by the cooperation that has been established between GPE and GPE through the NORP Declarations ... ”

Another leaflet , likewise published in DATE by ORG and entitled “ the NORP LAW for NORP ” , indicated that , as the declarations had been approved by the NORP people , they were “ binding on the NORP State ” .

Pursuant to the third sub - paragraph of CARDINAL of the PERSON of DATE , PERSON no . DATE of DATE established a national levy to provide compensation for NORP nationals who had been dispossessed of property situated in a territory that had previously been under NORP sovereignty or administration or had been a NORP protectorate . LAW provided : “ This levy shall constitute an advance payment on the sums owed by the foreign states or by persons who have benefited from the dispossession ” .

Law nos . CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE and CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE provided for the payment of additional compensation . The PERSON of DATE also stipulated : “ The amount of compensation shall be restricted to MONEY per household ... [ and ] MONEY per person dispossessed ” . The PERSON of DATE provided for the grant of additional compensation calculated on the basis of a revaluation coefficient and limited to FRF CARDINAL or FRF CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL , depending on the circumstances .
